intro: Aporosa dioica, commonly known as the male and female plants of the same species, is a dioecious plant, meaning that male and female flowers are found on separate individuals. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and usually elliptical in shape. The flowers are small and clustered, with the male flowers producing stamens and the female flowers containing pistils.
